messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] identifying utori technique
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Ron, Yes, I ll be there and I m looking forward to the discussion.  I ll bring along a pair of ko-Mino menuki that have slight loss to the uttori that makes
messages.messageBody:
Hi Ron,
Yes, I'll be there and I'm looking forward to the discussion. I'll bring along a pair of ko-Mino menuki that have slight loss to the uttori that makes the way it was attached particularly clear. Maybe Saturday afternoon before the NBTHK American branch meeting would be a good time.

Speaking of which, the American branch decided to add fittings study to their meeting agenda. It'll be a good study opportunity for sword fittings students attending the Tampa, Chicago and/or SF shows. I uploaded a membership form to the group file page at http://tinyurl.com/5xeyy for anyone interested. The topic at Tampa will be Kanayama, Owari and Ko-Shoami tsuba.

Jim



Another topic which we discussed awhile ago was to understand and recognize the use of gold utori overlay on fittings, what is true "utori" and what is not.

Jim Gilbert mentioned recently that he plans to be at the Tampa show this year if all goes well. I don't recall just who all became involved in our on-line discussion of "utori" but I for one, plan on bringing along a few examples of what "I" call utori and also a few examples of what I have my doubts about being "true" utori technique. Keep this in mind and if we can gather a few of us together for a short while that weekend, maybe with Jim's leadership we could all learn something about "utori" work. I will have a table to sit down at or if not there, certainly a quiet corner can be found somewhere there. I for one look forward to some discussion on this topic!

Ron
STL


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] identifying utori technique
messages.msgSnippet: Looking forward to fondling some early fittings with uttori next week. Will bring a few menuki examples along for discussion, including a few that appear to
messages.messageBody:
Looking forward to fondling some early fittings with uttori next week. Will bring a few menuki examples along for discussion, including a few that "appear" to have uttori overlay but I suspect, are something else, another technique. We shall see, eh?

Ron
STL
----- Original Message -----
From: Gordon Robson
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 31, 2005 5:29 PM
Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] identifying utori technique


Hi all,



This year I will be doing kodogu and koshirae with Jim's help. I will
certainly have a number of pieces that have genuine uttori overlays with me.
So, we can continue the Tampa discussion in SF. I have expanded my Ko-Mino
collection, so there will be a chance to compare Ko-Mino, Ko-Kinko and
Ko-Goto pieces as well.



Gordon
